Placemark.name: Seaver Science Library
Placemark.description: The Science & Engineering Library provides resources for the life sciences, earth sciences, physical sciences, mathematics and engineering.

Placemark.name: Vivian Hall
Placemark.description: Vivian Hall is home to programs of the USC Viterbi School of Engineering, including materials science and the Merwyn C. Gill Foundation Composites Center.

department.name: Department of Astronautical Engineering (Astronautics & Space Technology Division)

Placemark.name: Lindhurst Fine Arts Gallery
Placemark.description: Located on the first floor of Watt Hall, the Lindhurst Fine Arts Gallery offers weekly thematic exhibits of new works by fine arts students, faculty and guest artists spanning all media � from sculpture and painting to ceramics and digital media.

Placemark.name: Andrus Gerontology Center
Placemark.description: This building is home to the Davis School of Gerontology, the oldest and largest school of gerontology in the world. A pioneer in the field, The Davis School offered the world�s first Ph.D program in Gerontology, the first joint master�s degree with Gerontology and Business Administration and the first undergraduate Health Science Track in Gerontology.

Placemark.name: Mudd Hall
Placemark.description:
A cherished landmark modeled after a medieval Tuscan monastery, Mudd Hall is home to the USC Dornsife College of Letters, Arts and Sciences� School of Philosophy and the James Harmon Hoose Library of Philosophy. The building was designed by noted architect Ralph Carlin Flewelling, son of USC philosophy professor Ralph Tyler Flewelling, who began developing Hoose Library of Philosophy, one of the best collections of philosophy texts in the world.description>
School of Philosophy http://dornsife.usc.edu/phil/home/index.cfm Room 113
Philosophy Library Room 202

Placemark.name: Hazel & Stanley Hall Financial Services Building

department.name: Office for the Protection of Research Subjects

Placemark.name: Trojan Bookstore
Placemark.description: This bookstore has everything you need to be a well-equipped USC student, parent, alum or fan. The basement offers a men and women�s clothing store, makeup counter and computer store. The first floor is a general bookstore, complete with novels, magazines and more. The second floor features fantastic Trojan apparel and the third floor offers course textbooks and other classroom supplies.

Placemark.name: Student Union
Placemark.description: The Student Union is one of the main hubs for extracurricular campus life. Housed inside are offices for cultural centers such as the Center for Black Cultural and Student Affairs, and Asian Pacific American Student Services. Here you will also find the USC Ticket Office, a pharmacy, the Career Center, Disability Services, and the Daily Trojan, USC�s student-run, daily newspaper.

department.name: Office of the Vice President for Student Affairs
Center for Black Culture & Student Affairs

Placemark.name: Tutor Campus Center
Placemark.description: Opened in fall 2010, the Ronald Tutor Campus Center is a gathering place at the heart of the University Park campus. The four-story building, built around the splendid International Plaza, houses the Admission Center and the Epstein Family Alumni Center, along with student offices and work space, multipurpose areas for events and gatherings, meeting and boardrooms for student organizations, study lounges, technology resources, game and entertainment areas, and dining options.
Placemark.name: Admission Center
Bridge Hall
Placemark.description: Bridge Hall and the adjacent Hoffman Hall are home to the Marshall School of Business. Marshall offers a four-year business program that allows students to pursue interdisciplinary work and multiple concentrations. Its prestigious faculty, location in Los Angeles and access to an active alumni network, make this program one of the leading business schools in the nation.

department.name: Office of the Dean/Vice Dean for Undergrad and Grad. Prog.
Center for Inv. Stu. Finance & Business Economics
Lloyd Greif Center for Entrepreneurial Studies

Placemark.name: Hoffman Hall
Placemark.description: Hoffman Hall houses undergraduate programs of the USC Marshall School of Business.

Placemark.name: Leventhal School of Accounting
Placemark.description: The Leventhal School of Accounting is the long-standing sister school to the Marshall School of Business. All Accounting majors follow the same track as Business Administration majors for their first two years, then split off into two years of accounting-specific classes. USC�s accounting program is nationally recognized and prepares students to achieve the highest levels of success in the accounting industry.

Placemark.name: Musick Law Building
Placemark.description: The Musick Law Building is headquarters for the USC Gould School of Law.

Placemark.name: University Club
Placemark.description: The USC University Club is a members-only club and restaurant serving faculty, postdoctoral researchers and senior staff. Its facilities include a full-service restaurant, six banquet and meeting rooms, and al-fresco patio dining.

Placemark.name: Lewis Hall
Placemark.description: This hall stands as the main headquarters for the USC School of Policy, Planning, and Development, which combines practical hands-on work with a solid theoretical foundation.

department.name: School of Policy, Planning and Development

Placemark.name: Popovich Hall
Placemark.description: Opened in 1999, Popovich Hall provides a state-of-the-art home for graduate programs of the USC Marshall School of Business.

department.name: Fred V. Keenan MBA Career Resource Center

Placemark.name: Trojan Residence Hall
Placemark.description: This three-story residence hall houses Deans� Hall participants as well as other freshmen. It is conveniently located near other freshman housing and is right next door to the Ground Zero coffee house.

Placemark.name: Marks Tower
Placemark.description: Eight stories tall, this residence hall provides residents with spectacular views of the Los Angeles skyline as well as a place to live, study and socialize. Marks Tower is close to campus libraries, dining facilities and the popular Ground Zero coffee house.

Placemark.name: Pardee Tower
Placemark.description: Built to house Olympians during the 1984 games in Los Angeles, Pardee Tower is now a popular residence hall for freshmen. The building features a number of common areas and is close to Doheny Memorial Library and McCarthy Quad.

Placemark.name: Parking Structure C (X)
Placemark.description: Enter at the Figueroa Street Entrance at 35th Street (Entrance 3).

Placemark.name: University Gardens Building
Placemark.description: The University Gardens Building houses a number of USC's administrative offices, including Purchasing Services, Disbursements Control and Accounts Payable, Supplier Diversity Services, and Travel Management and Corporate Card Services.

Placemark.name: Radisson Mid-City Hotel
Placemark.description: In addition to being a full-service hotel serving the needs of the University Park area as a whole, the Radisson is home to freshmen who occupy several student-only floors each year. Students living in the hotel are fully integrated into campus life and able to take advantage of many of the benefits the Radisson has to offer.

Placemark.name: Parkside Apartments
Placemark.description: Parkside Apartments encompasses a pair of two-story buildings offering a mix of apartment types for students at all levels. Together with the nearby Arts and Humanities Residential College and International Residential College, the facility is part of the larger Parkside residential community.

Placemark.name: International Residential College at Parkside
Placemark.description: Opened in January 2002, the International Residential College at Parkside was specifically designed to foster cross-cultural understanding and learning for domestic and international students at USC.

Placemark.name: Parkside Restaurant
Placemark.description: Parkside Restaurant, located in the International Residential College at Parkside, serves international cuisine specialties from four exhibition stations and also offers vegetarian selections, kosher meals, sandwiches and salads.

department.name: School of Engineering � Office of the Dean

Placemark.name: Hughes Aircraft Electrical Engineering Center
Placemark.description: The Hughes Aircraft Electrical Engineering Center houses programs of the USC Viterbi School of Engineering�s Ming Hsieh Department of Electrical Engineering. It is also home to the USC Stevens Institute for Innovation.

Placemark.name: Von KleinSmid Center
Placemark.description: Named for USC's fifth president, the Von KleinSmid Center for International and Public Affairs houses USC College's School of International Relations, Department of Anthropology, Department of Art History and Department of Political Science as well as the USC Office of Globalization and the Von KleinSmid Center Library for Applied Social Sciences. The facility also is home to the Tyler Environmental Prize Pavilion.

Placemark.name: Zemeckis Center for Digital Arts
Placemark.description: The Robert Zemeckis Center for Digital Arts is the country�s first fully digital filmmaking training center.

Placemark.name: Shrine Auditorium
Placemark.description: The historic Shrine Auditorium is home to USC's Institute of Modern Russian Culture(IMRC), which is concerned with the cultural history of Russia -- especially the visual arts and literature during the 19th and 20th centuries.

Placemark.name: Corsica
Placemark.description: The Corsica is a two-story building with a mix of apartment types, located across the street from the historic Shrine Auditorium, less than two blocks from campus.

Placemark.name: Rosso Oro's Pizzeria
Placemark.description: Rosso's Pizzeria serves thin-crust pizza as well as salads and standard Italian dishes in a casual atmosphere.

Placemark.name: Biegler Hall
Placemark.description: Biegler Hall, the university's first engineering building dedicated in 1939, is home to the Tsunami Research Center.

Placemark.name: Bing Theatre
Placemark.description: The USC School of Theatre�s premier venue as well as a setting for musical performances, Bing Theatre is a traditional proscenium house with seating for 551.

Placemark.name: Annenberg Auditorium
Placemark.description: The 220-seat Annenberg Auditorium is a popular venue for lectures and special events.

Placemark.name: Annenberg School for Communication & Journalism
Placemark.description: This building was named for Walter Annenberg, former US Ambassador and founder of Seventeen Magazine and TV Guide. The Annenberg School is one of the leaders in the fields of Communication, Journalism and Public Relations. It incorporates study abroad, internships, research and digital media to complement the academic learning environment. Students also have the opportunity to get hands-on experience by participating in Annenberg TV News, Annenberg News Radio and the Daily Trojan student newspaper.

Placemark.name: Parking Structure One
Placemark.description: Pay-by-use lot. Enter off of Vermont Avenue (Entrance 7)or Jefferson Boulevard (Entrance 8).

Placemark.name: Marcia Lucas Building
Placemark.description: The Marcia Lucas Building houses sound and video facilities as well as the USC School of Cinematic Arts� John C. Hench Division of Animation and Digital Arts.

department.name: Division of Animation and Digital Arts Office

Placemark.name: George Lucas Building
Placemark.description: The George Lucas Instructional Building is home to many classrooms as well as the administrative offices of the dean and the writing, production, interactive media, critical studies and Peter Stark Producing Program of the USC School of Cinematic Arts.

Placemark.name: Spielberg Stage
Placemark.description: The Steven Spielberg Music Scoring Stage includes a recording studio large enough to accommodate 50 musicians, a digital console and state-of-the-art recording equipment.

Placemark.name: Carson Center
Placemark.description: This 3,600-square-foot facility includes a television sound stage that accommodates film shoots for students in the USC School of Cinematic Arts. Beneath the stage are classrooms and lab space for the Interactive Media Division as well as the school�s admissions, student affairs, student/industry relations, and festivals.

Placemark.name: Lloyd Stage
Placemark.description: The 3,600-square-foot Harold Lloyd Motion Picture Scoring Stage includes a 30-foot grid and catwalk system and accommodates film shoots for students in the USC School of Cinematic Arts.

department.name: Claire Zellerbach Saroni Student Health Center

Placemark.name: Norris Dental Science Center
Placemark.description: The Norris Dental Science Center is home to the educational and clinical programs of the USC School of Dentistry. Under the supervision of the school's expert faculty, student doctors and residents provide high-quality oral health care at reduced rates in the facility's clinical areas.

Placemark.name: School of Cinematic Arts
Placemark.description: The new USC School of Cinematic Arts complex, completed in 2010, comprises seven buildings totaling 200,000 square feet. The facility houses a broad range of projects and personnel, including post-production suites, classrooms, screening rooms, conference and seminar facilities, and administrative offices. The main buildings also encompass a 200-seat theatre, an exhibition hall and a caf�, and rise above a sweeping main courtyard.

Placemark.name: Lyon Center
Placemark.description: The 66,000-square foot Lyon University Center hosts an array of intercollegiate athletic events. The Center's 21,800 square foot gym and smaller auxiliary gym serve as an occasional home to both Women's Basketball and Men's Volleyball. To serve student extracurricular fitness activities, Lyon Center has a sauna and a Jacuzzi, student recreation club offices, equipment rental and sales, men's and women's locker rooms, a weight room, 4 racquetball courts, 2 squash courts, group exercise room, stretching areas, and cardiovascular equipment.

Placemark.name: Webb Tower
Placemark.description: USC�s tallest student residence, 14-story Webb Tower features one- and two-bedroom apartment living, a spectacular view of the city, and a short walk to Lyon University Center.

Placemark.name: Jefferson Building
Placemark.description: The Jefferson Building houses programs of the USC Dornsife College of Letters, Arts and Sciences.

Placemark.name: McClintock Building & Theatre
Placemark.description: The McClintock Building houses programs of the USC School of Theatre, featuring studio classrooms, offices, a recording studio and a video reference library as well as a 99-seat black-box theatre used for MFA acting productions and dramatic writing workshops.

Placemark.name: Parking Structure B
Placemark.description: Parking for students, faculty and staff with permits only, for guests by reservation, and for Norris Dental Science Center clinic patients.

Placemark.name: Irani Hall
Placemark.description: The 100,000-square-foot Ray R. Irani Hall houses interdisciplinary programs of the USC Dornsife College of Letters, Arts and Sciences and is dedicated to cross-disciplinary research in biological sciences

Placemark.name: Norris Cinema Theatre
Placemark.description: This 341-seat motion picture theatre, equipped with THX sound, regularly hosts USC School of Cinematic Arts classes, film screenings and special events.

Placemark.name: Doheny Memorial Library
Placemark.description: Historic Edward L. Doheny Jr. Memorial Library has served as an intellectual center and cultural treasure for students, faculty, staff and campus visitors since it opened in 1932. Created as a memorial to Edward L. Doheny Jr., a USC trustee and alumnus, this landmark building was USC�s first freestanding library. It houses vast collections of books and journals and also is one of the university�s best loved gathering places, hosting academic and cultural events ranging from lectures, readings and conferences to special exhibits and concerts.

Placemark.name: Bovard Administration Building
Placemark.description: Perhaps the most iconic of the University Park campus's Italian Romanesque-style buildings, Bovard Administration Building houses many of the university's central administrative offices as well as an auditorium that is one of the oldest and busiest performance venues in Southern California.

Placemark.name: Physical Education Building
Placemark.description: The Physical Education Building was built in 1933 and is among the classic buildings on the USC campus. The North Gym's cozy environment and tight quarters continually provide one of the most intimidating homecourt advantages in the Pac-10.

Placemark.name: Heritage Hall
Placemark.description: Home to USC�s Department of Intercollegiate Athletics, Heritage Hall encompasses administrative and coaches� offices as well as the McAlister Academic Resource Center, the Jess Hill Weight Room, and displays of trophies, plaques and other mementos highlighting the Trojan athletic heritage.

Placemark.name: Galen Athletic Center
Placemark.description: The Galen Athletic Center is a 5,400-square-foot sports-themed restaurant located adjacent to Heritage Hall.

Placemark.name: Leavey Library
Placemark.description: Leavey Library provides an environment for inquiry, discovery and intellectual stimulation geared to undergraduate learning needs. Leavey maintains a broad-based, general education-level collection in a variety of formats, including 45,000 books, more than 3,000 audiovisual titles and access to electronic and online texts. The library is open 24 hours a day, except from midnight to 9 a.m. on Sunday, when classes are in session.

Placemark.name: Birnkrant Residential College
Placemark.description: This eight-story residence hall, a favorite with freshmen, is conveniently located next to Leavey Library and the EVK dining hall. The popular Trojan Grounds coffee house can be found on the ground floor.

Placemark.name: EVerybody's Kitchen
Placemark.description: Located adjacent to Birnkrant and New Residential Colleges, EVerybody's Kitchen (EVK) offers American cuisine entrees, Mexican and vegetarian stations, sandwiches, salads and desserts.

Placemark.name: North Residential College
Placemark.description: This freshman residential college is made up of two buildings, May Ormerod Harris Residence Hall and University Residence Hall, and is conveniently located near campus libraries, dining venues, and other residence facilities for freshmen.

Placemark.name: Davidson Continuing Education Center
Placemark.description: Located at the intersection of Figueroa Street and Jefferson Boulevard, USC�s Davidson Continuing Education Center provides a state-of-the-art environment for conferences, executive meetings and continuing-education programs

Placemark.name: Parking Structure D
Placemark.description: Enter at the Jefferson Boulevard Entrance at Royal Street (Entrance 4).

Placemark.name: Montgomery Ross Fisher Building
Placemark.description: The Montgomery Ross Fisher Building is home to the USC School of Social Work.

Placemark.name: Stoops Hall
Placemark.description: Stoops Hall opened its doors in 1923 as the University Branch of the Los Angeles Public Library, and until Doheny Memorial Library debuted in 1932, it served as the main library for USC students. It became part of the university in 1965, and for 33 years was home to the Education Library.

Placemark.name: Jeanette MacDonald Recital Hall
Placemark.description: The 1,752-square-foot, 100-seat Jeanette MacDonald Recital Hall is the newest facility to join the USC Thornton lineup. This hall is home to the Charles Hirt Choral Lab and provides an intimate venue for student recitals, master classes and choral ensemble performances.

Placemark.name: University Religious Center
Placemark.description: The University Religious Center is headquarters for the USC Office of Religious Life.

Placemark.name: United University Church
Placemark.description: A full-service church where "all are welcome," United University Church is a progressive ecumenical congregation with Methodist and Presbyterian roots. The church offers a number of programs serving members of the USC community, and makes its facilities available for many campus meetings and events, including the USC Thornton Schools� popular �Music at Noon" concerts.
